channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 10 Brondesbury villas, 19th July
item.description:
Overhanging hedge blocking the pavement for us pedestrians at 10 brondesbury villas

item.title: The whole of fellows road and all over Belsize Park, 19th July
item.description:
There are weeds growing all over the pavement. The app is not letting me upload photos but the weeds are unmissable - ugly, obtrusive and ubiquitous. There are sections of fellows road that feel post-apocalyptic. I’m confident Camden is failing in its statutory obligations, because it’s not an isolated incident - they are everywhere.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 86, Fellows Road, Belsize Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the corner of Loveridge and Ariel road, 19th July
item.description:
Tree is very low, cannot walk under it. Dangerous as the branch can hit pedestrians on the head or face.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1,3,5,7,9,11,13,15, Ariel Road, Kilburn, London

item.title: Potholes in the High Street road., 19th July
item.description:
Large potholes in the 'High Street' road that links up with Station Road. Very jarring on the vehicles. Can these holes and broken tarmac be fixed permanently this time, please? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 137, Star Lane, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree branch has snapped from heavy rain today, 19th July
item.description:
Tree branch has snapped today and needs to be removed as it is close to footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Street, Goddington, London

item.title: Overhanging tree at the end of Holligrave Road, 19th July
item.description:
There is a large overhanging tree with branches that are slowly breaking off and are becoming a trip hazard. It has been an issue for at least a month now

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Holligrave Road, Plaistow, London

item.title: Car blocking access, 19th July
item.description:
Nobody can leave or gain access to there property we all are having to park on other roads around farm vale this is huge distress for residents as emergency vehicles would not be able to gain access being a fire or ambulance

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farm Vale, Bexley, London

item.title: No Entry sign has been rotated and is not visible, 19th July

item.title: Litter next to entrance gate, 19th July
item.description:

item.title: Overflowing sewage system, 19th July
item.description:
There has been a overflow of sewage outside our building, creating a toxic and unbearable smell. The situation is so bad that we cannot open our balcony doors or windows. It also poses serious health risks to residents and local pets.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Noisy and loose Manhole cover, 19th July
item.description:
Patch in road outside 4d Le May Avenue is very noisy and loose. It bangs every time traffic passes over it. Its right by the bus stop and the noise is terrible both during the day and night. I have reported it before months ago. please can something be done soon to fix it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Le May Avenue, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet
